name.japanese: 神の島（アッパーヤード）

description: The sacred land of Skypiea, formerly part of Jaya before being launched into the sky 400 years ago. The site of the final battle between Luffy and Enel.

keyEvents.title: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Hanabi to clear the sky
keyEvents.description: Luffy destroys Enel's Raigo thundercloud above Upper Yard, saving the land from destruction.
keyEvents.significance: The clearing of the sky symbolizes the end of Enel's dark reign over Upper Yard.

keyEvents.title: Enel transforms into 200,000,000 Volt Amaru
keyEvents.description: Enel unleashes his ultimate form above Upper Yard in a desperate attempt to defeat Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the full extent of Enel's power in his final stand.

keyEvents.title: Enel's Defeat at Upper Yard
keyEvents.description: Luffy defeats Enel above Upper Yard, ending his tyrannical reign over the sacred land.
keyEvents.significance: Liberates Upper Yard from Enel's oppression and ends the 400-year conflict.

description: The legendary golden bell of Shandora, located in the ruins of the ancient city. Silent for 400 years until Luffy rang it by defeating Enel.

keyEvents.title: The Golden Bell Rings After 400 Years
keyEvents.description: Luffy's punch sends Enel crashing into the Golden Bell, causing it to ring for the first time in 400 years. The sound proves the existence of the City of Gold.
keyEvents.significance: Fulfills a 400-year-old promise, vindicates Noland's legacy, and symbolizes peace between Skypieans and Shandia.

statusHistory.reason: Bell had not been rung for 400 years
Luffy rang the bell by defeating Enel

description: A sky island located 10,000 meters above the Blue Sea. Home to the Skypieans and the setting for the climactic end of Enel's reign.

keyEvents.title: Sky Clears Over Skypiea
keyEvents.description: Luffy clears the sky, dissipating Enel's Raigo and bringing the sun back to Skypiea.
keyEvents.significance: Symbolizes the end of darkness and tyranny over Skypiea.

description: An island in the Grand Line's Paradise, formerly connected to Upper Yard before it was launched into the sky. Home to Mont Blanc Cricket.

keyEvents.title: Cricket Hears the Golden Bell from Jaya
keyEvents.description: Mont Blanc Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance hear the Golden Bell ring from Jaya, proving the City of Gold exists in the sky.
keyEvents.significance: Vindicates Noland's legacy and frees Cricket from his 400-year family burden.
